title: Cl + O3 mechanism - reaction energy profile

content.description: When free Cl(g) atoms encounter O3(g) molecules in the upper atmosphere, the following reaction mechanism is proposed to occur.
content.question: Which of the following reaction energy profiles best corresponds to the proposed mechanism?

choices.label: A graph plots Energy versus Reaction Progress. A curve plotted on the graph, with a decreasing trend, initially extends horizontally, rises to peak at a maximum value, then declines sharply to a lower energy level than what it started with, and then extends horizontally.

A graph plots Energy against Reaction Progress. A curve plotted on the graph, with a decreasing trend, initially extends horizontally, rises to peak at a maximum value, declines, and rises again slightly. It then declines sharply to a lower energy level than what it started with and finally extends horizontally.

A graph plots Energy against Reaction Progress. A curve plotted on the graph, with a decreasing trend, initially extends horizontally, rises to peak at a maximum value, declines to a very low energy level, and then rises to a high energy level. It then declines sharply to a lower energy level than what it started with and finally extends horizontally.

A graph plots Energy against Reaction Progress. A curve plotted on the graph, with an increasing trend, initially extends horizontally, rises slightly, then declines slightly, and rises sharply to a peak value. It then declines slightly to an energy level higher than what it started with and finally extends horizontally.

content.answer: A graph plots Energy against Reaction Progress. A curve plotted on the graph, with a decreasing trend, initially extends horizontally, rises to peak at a maximum value, declines, and rises again slightly. It then declines sharply to a lower energy level than what it started with and finally extends horizontally.

skill.text: 3.B: Represent chemical substances or phenomena with appropriate diagrams or models (e.g., electron configuration).
